p: In order to determine the amount of W 5+ within the raw material, an iodometric titration was performed on the blue sample powder, which can easily be dissolved in aqueous solution. The blue sample was dissolved with a soda pellet and an excess of potassium iodide. The I 2 reaction product formed from the redox process between I − and W 5+ ions is then titrated with sodium thiosulfate (S 2O 4 2− reducing ion). The tests gave an average delta value of 0.018, leading to the formula of the raw powder W 6+ 0.982W 5+ 0.036O 2.982.
